definition: to speak bluntly (idiom)/not to mince words
straight/to straighten/fair and reasonable/frank/straightforward/(indicates continuing motion or action)/vertical/vertical downward stroke in Chinese characters
surname Zhi/Zhi (c. 2000 BC), fifth of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
to avoid mentioning/taboo word/name of deceased emperor or superior

sentences.english: Those are blunt, unyielding admonitions that ring in my head every day.
sentences.chinese: 那些直言不讳的忠告每天都在我头脑中响起。

sentences.english: The Street and media responded well to her bluntness.
sentences.chinese: 业内和媒体对于她的直言不讳反应良好。

sentences.english: The EC is not paid by Pakistan, so I can be outspoken.
sentences.chinese: 由于巴基斯坦不向欧共体交钱，所以我可以直言不讳。
他是一个直言不讳的人。

sentences.english: She minces no words in stating her opinions.
sentences.chinese: 她表达观点总是直言不讳。

sentences.english: He pointed out the shortcomings in our work time and again without mincing words.
sentences.chinese: 他不止一次直言不讳地指出我们工作中的缺点。

sentences.english: In this case, we will be completely blunt.
sentences.chinese: 在这种情况下，我们将直言不讳。

sentences.english: "What were you shooting at, at the bend?" Agustin asked bluntly.
sentences.chinese: “你在拐弯那里打谁呢？”奥古斯丁直言不讳地问。

sentences.english: I will speak agaist anything I know to be wrong.
sentences.chinese: 我会对我认为不对的事情直言不讳。

sentences.english: He was a vocal critic of the country's Anti-Homosexuality bill.
sentences.chinese: 他曾直言不讳地批评乌干达反同性恋的法案。

sentences.english: I'll speak aganist anything I know to be wrong.
sentences.chinese: 我会对于所有我认为不对于的事情直言不讳。

sentences.english: , and long one of the more outspoken relatives.
sentences.chinese: 他是死难者亲属中最直言不讳的。

sentences.english: We should listen closely to the outspoken criticisms.
sentences.chinese: 我们应该仔细倾听直言不讳的批评。

sentences.english: I will speak against anythellong Iknow to be wrong.
sentences.chinese: 我会对于所有我认为不对于的事情直言不讳。

sentences.english: I was rather blunt in my reply.
sentences.chinese: 我的回答相当直言不讳。

sentences.english: But in general, directness is worth a try, " he says.
sentences.chinese: 但是通常情况下，直言不讳还是值得一试。

definition: lit. to draw blood on the first prick (idiom)/fig. to hit the nail on the head
to tell the truth/to tell it as it is
see 直截了當|直截了当[zhi2 jie2 liao3 dang4]
to blab/to shoot one's mouth off/to commit a gaffe
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
to play a joke/to make fun of/to joke
